Comment.Language: Then deacon chants the psalm in the (Adribi) tune.
ثم يرتل الشماس المزمور بالطريقه الادريبي.

Text.Language: Wouniatf m~v/e~takcotpf ouoh aksopf e~rok: efe~swpi qen nekaul/ou sa e~neh.
Blessed is he whom You choose and bring near, to dwell in Your courts!
طوبى للذي تختاره وتقربه، ليسكن في ديارك.
Cwtem e~ron Vnou] Pencwt/r: ]helpic n~te aur/jf m~p~kahi t/rf.
Answer us with deliverance, O God of our salvation, who are the hope of all the ends of the earth.
تستجيبنا يا اله خلاصنا يا متكل جميع اقاصي الارض.
Kot] ta'u,/ epema n~emton je a~ P[oic erpeynanef n/i.
Return, O my soul, to your rest; for the Lord has dealt bountifully with you.
إرجعي يا نفسي إلى راحتك لأن الرب قد احسن اليكِ.
W P[oic nohem n~ta'u,/: ouna/t pe P[oic ouoh ouy~m/i pe.
“O Lord, I beseech You, save my life!” Gracious is the Lord, and righteous.
يا رب نج نفسي. الرب حنّان وصديق
For He remembered that they were but flesh, A breath that passes away and does not come again.
ذَكَرَ أَنَّهُمْ بَشَرٌ. رِيحٌ تَذْهَبُ وَلاَ تَعُودُ.
Paiwt nem tamau netau,at n~cwou: P[oic de petafsopt e~rof.
My father and my mother have forsaken me, but the Lord will take me up.
إن ابي وامي قد تركاني والرب يضمّني.
V/eta~reh e~nikouji n~alwoui pe P[oic: aiyebioi ouoh afnahmet.
The Lord preserves the simple; when I was brought low, He saved me.
الرب حافظ البسطاء. تذللت فخلصني.
Je a~nok ousemmo a~nok hijen p~kahi ouoh n~remn~jwili m~v~r/] n~nakeio] t/rou ,w n/i. Hina n~ta,~bob m~pa]sen/i ouoh n~tas~temswpi je.
For I am Your passing guest, a sojourner, like all my fathers. Look away from me, that I may know gladness, before I depart and be no more!”
لاني أنا غريب عندك. نزيل مثل جميع آبائي. اقتصر عني فاتبلج قبل أن أذهب فلا اوجد
Efe~cwtem e~rok n~je P[oic qen pie~hoou n~te pekhojhej: efe~] e~h~r/i e~jwk n~je v~ran m~Vnou] n~Iakwb.
The Lord hear you in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob defend you.
لِيَسْتَجِبْ لَكَ الرَّبُّ فِي يَوْمِ ضِيقِكَ. لِيَحْرُسْكَ اسْمُ إِلَهِ يَعْقُوبَ.
Efe~ouwrp nak n~oubo/yia e~bol qen peyouab. Efe~sopk e~rof e~bol qen Ciwn.
Send help from the sanctuary, and aid out of Sion.
لِيُرْسِلْ لَكَ عَوْناً مِنْ مَقْدِسِهِ، وَأَزْراً مِنْ صِهْيَوْنَ.
}naouwnh nak e~bol P[oic je auersv/ri m~mok qen ouho]: hans~v/ri ne nekh~b/oui~ ouoh a~ tau,/ emi e~masw.
I will give You thanks; for You are fearfully wondrous; wondrous are Your works; and my soul knows it well.
أَحْمَدُكَ لأَنَّكَ صَنَعْتَنِي بِإِعْجَازِكَ الْمُدْهِشِ. مَا أَعْجَبَ أَعْمَالَكَ وَنَفْسِي تَعْلَمُ ذَلِكَ يَقِيناً.
Mpefhwn n~je pakac cabol m~mok v/ etakyamiof qen peth/p.
My bones, which You made in secret, were not hidden from You.
لَمْ يَخْفَ عَلَيْكَ كِيَانِي عِنْدَمَا كُوِّنْتُ فِي السِّرِّ،
Wouniatf m~v/etakcotpf ouoh aksopf e~rok: efe~swpi qen nekaul/ou sa e~neh:
Blessed is he whom You have chosen and have taken to Yourself, he shall dwell in Your courts forever.
طوبى لمن اخترته وقبلته ، ليسكن فى ديارك إلى الآبد.
F~ouab n~je pekervei ouoh f~oi n~s~v/ri qen oumeym/i.
Holy is Your temple, wonderful in righteousness.
قدوس هو هيكلك وعجيب بالبر.
Eie~swpi qen pekman~swpi sa e~neh: eie~[iq/ibi qa t~c~kep/ n~te nektenh.
Let me dwell in Your tent forever! Oh to be safe under the shelter of Your wings!
لاسكنن في مسكنك الى الدهور. احتمي بستر جناحيك.
Nyok Vnou] akcwtem e~naeu,/: ak] n~ouk~l/ronomia n~n/eterho] qat~h/ m~pekran.
For You, O God, have heard my vows, You have given me the heritage of those who fear Your name.
لانك انت يا الله استمعت نذوري.اعطيت ميراث خائفي اسمك.
He who dwells in the secret place of the Most High Shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
اَلسَّاكِنُ فِي سِتْرِ الْعَلِيِّ فِي ظِلِّ الْقَدِيرِ يَبِيتُ.
I will say of the Lord, “He is my refuge and my fortress; My God, in Him I will trust.”
أَقُولُ لِلرَّبِّ: [مَلْجَإِي وَحِصْنِي. إِلَهِي فَأَتَّكِلُ عَلَيْهِ].
Hen y/nou cabol m~moi ouon niben eterhwb e~]anomia~: a~ P[oic cwtem e~t~c~m/ n~te parimi. P[oic afcwtem e~pa]ho. A P[oic swp n~tap~roceu,/ e~rof.
Depart from me, all you that work iniquity; for the Lord has heard the voice of my weeping. The Lord has hearkened to my petition; the Lord has accepted my prayer.
ابْتَعِدُوا عَنِّي يَاجَمِيعَ فَاعِلِي الإِثْمِ، لأَنَّ الرَّبَّ قَدْ سَمِعَ صَوْتَ بُكَائِي. سَمِعَ الرَّبُّ تَضَرُّعِي. الرَّبُّ يَتَقَبَّلُ صَلاَتِي.
Eue~[isipi ouoh eue~s~yorter e~masw n~je najaji t/rou. Eue~kotou e~vahou eue~[isipi e~masw n~,wlem.
Let all mine enemies be put to shame and sore troubled: let them be turned back and grievously put to shame speedily.
لِيَخْزَ جَمِيعُ أَعْدَائِي وَيَرْتَاعُوا جِدّاً، وَلْيَتَرَاجَعُوا إِذْ لَحِقَ بِهِمِ الْعَارُ فَجْأَةً.
H/ppe aiouei eiv/t ouoh aiswpi hip~safe: naijoust e~bol qat~h/ m~v/eynanahmet e~bol ha oumetkouji n~h/t nem oucaray/ou.
Lo! I have fled afar off, and lodged in the wilderness. I waited for him that should deliver me from distress of spirit and tempest.
كُنْتُ أَشْرُدُ هَارِباً وَأبِيتُ فِي الْبَرِّيَّةِ. كُنْتُ أُسْرِعُ لِلنَّجَاةِ مِنَ الرِّيحِ الْعَاصِفَةِ، وَمِنَ نَوْءِ الْبَحْرِ».
{ic~m/ Vnou] e~tameym/i ouoh mah~y/k e~pa]ho. <amasj e~tap~roceu,/ qen hanc~votou n~,~rof an.
Hearken, O Lord of my righteousness, attend to my petition; give ear to my prayer not uttered with deceitful lips.
اسْمَعْ يَارَبُّ دَعْوَى الْحَقِّ. أَنْصِتْ إِلَى صُرَاخِي، وَأَصْغِ إِلَى صَلاَتِي الصَّاعِدَةِ مِنْ شَفَتَيْنِ صَادِقَتَيْنِ.
Marefi~ n~je pahap e~bol hiten pekho. Mare nabal nau e~n/etcoutwn.
Let my judgment come forth from Your presence; let mine eyes behold righteousness.
لِيَخْرُجْ مِنْ أَمَامِكَ قَضَائِي، وَلْتُلاَحِظْ عَيْنَاكَ اسْتِقَامَتِي.
Auberbwrt e~bol a~nok pimenrit m~v~r/] n~ourefmwout eforeb.
Those also who render evil for good, they are my adversaries, because I follow what is good
رفضونى أنا الحبيب مثل ميت مرذول.
Mper,at n~cwk P[oic Panou] m~perouei cabol m~moi.
Do not forsake Me, O Lord; O My God, be not far from me.
فلا تهملنى يا ربى والهى.
